data.title: Gemspring Capital
data.meta_description: Gemspring provides flexible capital solutions to lower middle market companies headquartered primarily in the United States and Canada. We partner with industry leaders with growth potential that will benefit from our support and expertise.
data.text:
Bret Wiener

Founder & CEO

Bret Wiener is the Founder and CEO of Gemspring Capital. Over the course of his career, Bret has been involved in over 125 acquisitions across a broad range of industries.

Prior to founding Gemspring in 2015, Bret was a Managing Director at H.I.G. Capital where he spent 11 years. Bret also worked in Corporate Strategy at Microsoft and investment banking at Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette. Bret’s extensive experience includes earlier career stints as an institutional cook, a NYC messenger, and a telemarketing rep.

Bret received a BS, summa cum laude, from New York University and an MBA from Stanford University.

D.J. Andrzejewski

Managing Director

D.J. Andrzejewski is a Managing Director and member of the Investment Committee at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, D.J. was a Partner at PeakEquity Partners, a private equity firm focused on investments in growth-stage software companies. In his eight years with PeakEquity, D.J. was responsible for all aspects of the investment process including sourcing, structuring, and executing new investments. D.J. served as a board member for several portfolio companies including EnterpriseDB, CareerArc, BERA, and HighLevel. He was also involved in PeakEquity’s investments in G5 and Valiant Solutions.

Prior to PeakEquity Partners, D. J. worked on the investment team at Stripes, a New York-based growth equity firm with $7.7 billion in capital under management. At Stripes, D. J. sourced and executed investments across the software and technology sectors. D. J. began his career at Milestone Partners, a Philadelphia-based private equity firm, where he focused on leveraged buyouts and recapitalizations of middle market businesses across various industries.

D.J. serves on the board of ClearCompany.

D.J. received a BA from the University of Pennsylvania and an MBA from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

Geoff Broglio

Managing Director

Geoff Broglio is a Managing Director and a member of the Investment Committee at Gemspring Capital. Geoff brings nearly two decades of investment, strategic, and operational experience across business services, media and technology, industrials, distribution, transportation, and logistics. He has invested in leveraged buyouts, growth equity investments, corporate divestitures, minority investments, asset acquisitions, and recapitalizations, including leading more than 15 investments for Gemspring. Throughout his career, Geoff has been responsible for identifying and evaluating investment opportunities, structuring and negotiating transactions, and partnering with management teams to drive operational and growth initiatives.

Prior to Gemspring, Geoff was a Principal with Kingswood Capital, a lower middle market private equity firm. Before that, Geoff was a Vice President at Hudson Capital Management and an Associate at First Reserve. Earlier in his career, Geoff was an Analyst in the financial sponsors group of Citigroup’s investment banking division.

Geoff serves on the boards of Bridgeway Connects, Crafty Apes, Fenceworks, Midland Industries, Shrieve Chemical Company, and Wireless Vision. He previously served on the board of Therma Holdings.

Geoff received a BS in Business Information Technology and a BS in Finance from Virginia Tech.

Ravdeep Chanana

Managing Director

Ravdeep Chanana is a Managing Director and a member of the Investment Committee at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Rav was an executive at General Electric with experience working across eight countries and four different multi-billion dollar industrial and financial services business units. His most recent role was CFO of GE Additive, a new business unit within GE Aviation comprised of two strategic acquisitions completed in 2016. In this role, Rav was responsible for providing financial and operational leadership to drive the integration of the acquired companies. Prior to GE Additive, Rav was CFO of GE Aviation’s engineering organization and led a global finance team of ~70 employees where he was responsible for providing strategic and financial leadership for the ~$3 billion of annual research & development budget and ~8,000-person engineering organization.

Rav began his career in GE’s Financial Management Program. He completed roles in Corporate Finance, GE Capital headquarters, and GE Corporate Investor Relations. Rav then joined GE’s Corporate Audit Staff, ultimately progressing to Executive Audit Manager responsible for GE Aviation, a $25 billion revenue business segment, and the Services Council, supporting a GE Vice Chairman in driving best practices and processes across all of GE’s services businesses.

Rav serves on the boards of AMPAM, Carr & Duff, JTI, and Shrieve Chemical Company. In addition, Rav was formerly a board member of Radancy and Therma Holdings.

Rav received a BS in Finance and Accounting from Fairfield University.

Clay Cole

Managing Director

Clay Cole is a Managing Director and member of the Investment Committee at Gemspring Capital.

Clay has over fifteen years of experience partnering with founders and management teams to execute transactions across a variety of structures, including family and founder capital solutions, growth equity investments, buy and builds, and leveraged buyouts. Clay has invested across a broad array of industries, including business and tech-enabled services, IT services, industrial services, infrastructure and communications services, and distribution.

Prior to Gemspring, Clay was a Managing Director at A&M Capital Opportunities (“AMCO”). While at AMCO, Clay was responsible for all aspects of the investment lifecycle, including originating transactions, executing investments, and collaborating with management teams to orchestrate value-creation and growth initiatives. Prior to AMCO, Clay worked at General Catalyst Partners, H.I.G. Capital, and Stephens Inc.

Clay has served as a director and observer to numerous boards, including Crash Champions, Heartland Business Systems, Champion Optical Network Engineering, CLEAResult Consulting, and Envoy Global.

Clay received a BS in Industrial Engineering with a minor in General Business from the University of Arkansas.

Charlie Fraas

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations

Charlie Fraas is a Managing Director and Head of Portfolio Operations at Gemspring Capital. Charlie has over 25 years of experience leading transformations and driving profit enhancement. He has worked with over 50 clients executing projects across the strategic and operational spectrum, including strategic planning, post-merger integration, BPO / shared service adoption, robotics process automation, sourcing and procurement, supply chain network, lean manufacturing, and ERP / technology implementation.

Prior to Gemspring, Charlie led a boutique advisory firm focused on operational transformation, profit enhancement, and restructuring / turnaround engagements in a variety of industries, including aviation, brokerage, distribution, healthcare, manufacturing, real estate, retail, services, and technology, for clients including H.I.G. Capital and TPG. He has held various transformation leadership and restructuring roles including Interim CEO, Interim President, Interim COO, Chief Restructuring Officer (CRO), and Chancery Court Trustee (Delaware).

Previously, Charlie held several roles at 1800flowers.com, including Senior Vice President of Improvement, Senior Vice President of Operations, and COO, where he oversaw all operations, including call centers, distribution, transportation, sourcing and procurement, customer database marketing, and florist operations.

Prior to 1800flowers, Charlie started his career at Arthur Andersen and Deloitte Consulting, spending 13 years in various practices, including audit, bankruptcy and transaction advisory, marketing analytics, operations, retail industry, strategy, supply chain, and several technology teams.

Charlie serves on the boards of Insurvia, Outform, and Skyline.

Charlie received a BS in Accounting from Binghamton University and is a Six Sigma Black Belt.

Aron Grossman

Managing Director

Aron Grossman is a Managing Director and a member of the Investment Committee at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Aron was a Principal with Rho Capital, a technology-focused private equity firm with $1.4 billion in capital under management, where he focused on the origination and execution of enterprise software investments.

Prior to Rho, Aron spent five years in operational roles with software businesses, most recently as Founder and CEO of Cleanshelf, a software expense management company he bootstrapped and merged with a competitive business. Previously, Aron was an executive at Voxy, a venture-backed education technology company, where, in addition to being CFO, he played a central role in the sales, marketing, and operations activities driving the company’s growth.

Earlier in his career, Aron focused on business services, healthcare, and media / communications investments with Tailwind Capital, a middle-market private equity firm. Aron began his career as an investment banking Analyst with Houlihan Lokey.

Aron serves on the boards of Bobit, Cforia, GoldenSource, OPEXUS, and Sigga. In addition, Aron was formerly a board member of Valant.

Aron received a BA in Economics and Spanish from Emory University.

Andrew Lerner

Managing Director

General Counsel

Chief Compliance Officer

Andrew Lerner is a Managing Director and the General Counsel and Chief Compliance Officer of Gemspring Capital.

Prior to joining Gemspring, Andrew was a Managing Director and the Deputy General Counsel – Americas of Moelis & Company, and the General Counsel of Moelis Asset Management LP. Previously, Andrew served as a Director & Counsel at Credit Suisse. Andrew began his career as a corporate attorney at Fried, Frank, Harris, Shriver & Jacobson LLP in New York.

Andrew holds a JD from New York University School of Law, an MA in Political Science from The New School for Social Research, and an AB, magna cum laude, in Philosophy from Muhlenberg College.

Zubin Malkani

Managing Director

Zubin Malkani is a Managing Director and a member of the Investment Committee at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Zubin was a Managing Director at CI Capital Partners, a middle market private equity firm, where he worked for nearly a decade. While at CI Capital, Zubin led investments in business services and consumer services companies and served as a board member for numerous portfolio companies, including Hero Digital, PRA, SavATree, Total Fleet Solutions, and WTS International.

Prior to CI Capital, Zubin was an Associate at GTCR, where he focused on middle market leveraged buyouts, and an investment banking Analyst at Goldman, Sachs & Co., where he advised clients on mergers, acquisitions, and corporate finance transactions.

Zubin serves on the boards of Amplix and ROR Partners.

Zubin received a BBA from the University of Michigan and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Michael McCulloch

Managing Director

Research

Michael McCulloch is a Managing Director, Head of Research, and a member of the Investment Committee at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Michael was a Partner at Providence Public, the crossover public/private fund of Providence Equity Partners, a global private equity firm. In his four years at Providence, Michael was responsible for all aspects of the investment process, including the sourcing, diligence, and execution of new investments.

Prior to Providence, Michael was a Senior Analyst at ThornTree Capital where he focused on the media, telecom, and consumer sectors. Prior to ThornTree, Michael worked at Finepoint Capital, investing broadly across sectors, geographies, and asset classes. Michael began his investing career at Relational Investors, covering the industrials and materials sectors.

Michael received a BA in Economics and Political Science from Vanderbilt University and an MA in Finance from Claremont McKenna College.

Kal Mukherjee

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations

Kal Mukherjee is a Managing Director of Portfolio Operations at Gemspring Capital. Kal has over 25 years of experience working with C-suite leadership to drive growth, improve processes, and reduce costs. He specializes in operational excellence, pricing and strategic planning, M&A, and post-merger integration.

Prior to Gemspring, Kal was Operating Partner at Apollo Global Management where he partnered with portfolio management teams to drive operational improvement, pricing, sales force effectiveness, and overall process improvement.

Prior to Apollo, Kal worked at AlixPartners, Nielsen Media Research, Danaher Corporation, and McKinsey.

Kal received his BTech (Hons) in Mechanical Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, an MS from Penn State, and an MBA from University of Rochester.

Martin Mumford

Managing Director

Portfolio Operations

Martin Mumford is a Managing Director of Portfolio Operations at Gemspring Capital. Martin has experience working with C-suite leadership across a variety of industries to create value through operational improvement. He specializes in operational transformation, M&A integration, carve-outs, strategic planning, and organizational development.

Prior to Gemspring, Martin was at Angeles Equity Partners, where he was responsible for value creation in portfolio companies across manufacturing, distribution, services, and healthcare sectors. Prior to Angeles Equity, Martin was a Principal in Oliver Wyman’s Consumer, Industrial, and Services practice, where he worked on large-scale transformations for facilities services and retail clients. Before joining Oliver Wyman, Martin served as an Infantry Officer with the 101st Airborne Division of the United States Army.

Martin received a BA in International Relations from Stanford University and an MBA with honors from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, where he was a Palmer Scholar.

Matt Reibl

Managing Director

Chief Financial Officer

Matt Reibl is a Managing Director and the Chief Financial Officer at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Matt spent over eight years at Blackstone in various leadership roles. Most recently, Matt was a Principal on the Private Equity Portfolio Operations team where he led finance transformation efforts across several portfolio companies. Prior to that, Matt was a manager on Blackstone’s middle office finance team overseeing valuations, investor reporting, portfolio monitoring, and FP&A for various funds in the Private Equity segment.

Matt began his career in GE’s Financial Management Program in the Aviation segment. Matt then joined GE’s Corporate Audit Staff, completing assignments in GE’s Capital, Energy, and International divisions, ultimately progressing to Audit Manager.

Matt received a BS in Finance with minors in Accounting and Economics from Fairfield University.

Jay Reynolds

Managing Director

Jay Reynolds is a Managing Director and a member of the Investment Committee at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Jay was with The Riverside Company, a global private equity firm, where he worked for nearly a decade. While at Riverside, Jay was responsible for all aspects of the investment process, including sourcing, structuring and executing non-control investment opportunities, as well as post-investment collaboration with portfolio company management teams to implement growth plans.

Prior to Riverside, Jay was with Veronis Suhler Stevenson, a lower middle market private equity firm, where he executed control and non-control investments. Jay began his career as an investment banking analyst in the Media & Telecommunications group at Merrill Lynch, where he worked on M&A, leveraged finance, and equity capital transactions.

Jay serves on the boards of Sparkstone Electrical Group (fka Chicago Switchboard) and OCI.

Jay received a BS in Business Administration, magna cum laude, from Washington & Lee University.

Alex Shakibnia

Managing Director

Alex Shakibnia is a Managing Director and a member of the Investment Committee at Gemspring Capital. Alex has extensive experience structuring and executing transactions across a broad range of industries.

Prior to Gemspring, Alex spent three years at Friedman Fleischer and Lowe, a San Francisco based middle market private equity firm focused on executing both majority and minority growth equity investments. Alex began his career as an investment banking Analyst at Credit Suisse in Los Angeles where he focused on the execution of debt and equity transactions for companies in various sectors.

Alex serves on the boards of A10 Capital, Airswift, Insurvia, Outform, Security 101, and United Group Programs.

Alex received BA in Business Economics and Mathematics, cum laude, from UCLA and an MA in Finance from Claremont McKenna College.

Matt Shuman

Managing Director

Business Development

Matt Shuman is a Managing Director at Gemspring Capital. He is responsible for deal origination and leading the firm’s overall marketing and business development efforts.

Prior to Gemspring, Matt was with Northwestern Mutual. Previously, he ran the FX Prime Brokerage sales efforts for Royal Bank of Scotland and Barclays Capital, where he was responsible for a broad range of activities, including business development, origination, contract negotiation, and due diligence, and successfully led efforts in onboarding strategic relationships and rolling out new platforms for the banks’ Prime Brokerage businesses. Matt began his career as an Analyst on the Sales & Trading desks at J.P. Morgan in New York.

Matt received a BS in Finance from Syracuse University.

Kristin Steen

Managing Director

Kristin Steen is a Managing Director and a member of the Investment Committee at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Kristin was a Managing Director at CCMP Capital, a middle market private equity firm. While at CCMP, Kristin was responsible for all aspects of the investment process, including originating, evaluating, and executing investments, partnering with management teams to drive value creation, and serving on the boards of portfolio companies. She was involved in several of the firm’s investments, including Eating Recovery Center, The Hillman Group, Truck Hero, and other companies in the consumer, specialty manufacturing, and services sectors. Prior to joining CCMP, Kristin worked for Lone Star Funds and HBK Capital Management.

Kristin serves on the board of Bradford.

Kristin received a BS in Commerce from the McIntire School of Commerce at the University of Virginia.

Glenn Stevens

Managing Director

Head of Portfolio Talent

Glenn is a Managing Director and Head of Portfolio Talent at Gemspring Capital and has over 30 years of experience in talent management and retained executive recruitment. He has consulted with some of the world’s leading companies regarding their human capital management issues and strategic growth initiatives.

Prior to Gemspring, Glenn was a Partner at Apollo Global Management. At Apollo, Glenn focused on talent and leading management team and board construction for Apollo’s portfolio companies. Prior to Apollo, he was the Head of Talent Management at L Catterton, a consumer-focused private equity firm. Prior to L Catterton, Glenn held roles at Odgers Berndtson, The Gerson Group, Nobok Ltd., and A.T. Kearney.

Glenn received an AB in Politics from Princeton University.

Jack Tucker

Managing Director

Chief Operating Officer

Jack Tucker is a Managing Director and the Chief Operating Officer at Gemspring Capital. He is focused on Investor Relations, ESG Initiatives, Business Development, and Recruiting.

Prior to Gemspring, Jack was a Partner at Acalyx Advisors, where he raised capital from institutional investors for private equity funds. At Acalyx, Jack was involved in several milestone fundraisings in the buyout and growth segments. Jack also worked on a number of advisory mandates with general partners and helped develop and execute marketing strategies to assist general partners with ongoing investor relationship management. Jack began his career at MVision Private Equity Advisers, where he worked with general partners across the US and Europe.

Jack received a BA from the University of Delaware.

Mathew Wallace

Managing Director

Matt is a Managing Director and a member of the Investment Committee at Gemspring Capital. He is responsible for leading investing activities in the Industrials vertical and is focused on all industrial subsectors with an emphasis on chemicals & specialty materials, packaging, industrial technology, engineered equipment & components, specialty distribution, and industrial & infrastructure services.

Prior to Gemspring, Matt was a Managing Director on Cerberus Capital Management’s Private Equity team where he led private equity investments in the Industrials vertical. During his tenure with Cerberus, Matt was responsible for leading all aspects of the investment process including sourcing, structuring, and executing new investments, as well as portfolio management. While at Cerberus, he served as a board member for several portfolio companies including Closure Systems International, PQ Performance Chemicals, Cyanco, and Kellermeyer Bergensons Services.

Prior to Cerberus, Matt worked at H.I.G. Capital, RBC Capital Markets, and The Hartford Financial Services Group.

Matt received a BS in Business Administration from the University of Connecticut and an MBA from Columbia University. He is also a Lean Six Sigma Black Belt.

Dan Andrews

Principal

Dan Andrews is a Principal at Gemspring Capital and focuses on structured investment opportunities. Dan has over a decade of investing experience across various strategies in both public and private credit markets.

Prior to Gemspring, Dan was at Moab Partners, a value-oriented hedge fund, where he focused on special situations and event-driven investment opportunities. During his time at Moab, Dan invested in a wide array of credit products and focused on structured direct lending financings.

Earlier in his career, Dan was a Vice President at Morgan Stanley Credit Partners, a $1 billion credit opportunities fund within the Merchant Banking division of Morgan Stanley. Dan was part of a team responsible for investing both outside investor funds and Morgan Stanley capital, focusing on complex direct lending situations and stressed liquid credit opportunities. Dan began his career in the investment banking group of Robinson Humphrey and also spent time at MCG Capital, a publicly traded private equity and debt investment firm where he executed middle market investments across the capital structure and served as a portfolio company board director.

Dan received a BS in Commerce from the McIntire School of Commerce at the University of Virginia and an MBA from Columbia Business School.

Greg Barnes

Principal

Greg Barnes is a Principal at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Greg was a Vice President at Comvest Partners. While at Comvest, Greg was responsible for the evaluation, execution, and monitoring of control investments across multiple sectors with a focus on consumer. Prior to Comvest, Greg was an Associate at H.I.G. Capital.

Greg began his career as an investment banking Analyst at Barclays where he executed M&A and leveraged finance transactions across a range of industries.

Greg received a BS in Business Administration from Georgetown University.

Michael Fan

Principal

Michael Fan is a Principal at Gemspring Capital and focuses on investments in software. Michael has over a decade of experience in sourcing and executing transactions in the technology sector, as well as operating experience from founding and leading a digital media business.

Prior to Gemspring, Michael was at Rubicon Technology Partners, an enterprise software-focused private equity firm. Michael has also held roles within private equity at York Capital and Bain Capital, primarily focusing on technology investments. In these roles, Michael collaborated with management teams to execute strategic initiatives and served as a board director for multiple portfolio companies. Earlier in his career, Michael was the founder and CEO of a digital media business focused on car safety, and worked as a technology investment banking Analyst at Morgan Stanley.

Michael serves on the boards of GoldenSource and OPEXUS.

Michael received a BA in Economics with a minor in Computer Science from Stanford University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Chirag Hirawat

Principal

Chirag Hirawat is a Principal at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Chirag was a Vice President at BlackIvy Group, a US-based holding company that owns and operates essential services businesses in Sub-Saharan Africa. Prior to BlackIvy, Chirag was a Vice President at Golden Gate Capital, a private equity firm with $15 billion under management, where he evaluated and executed new investments and monitored portfolio companies in the consumer and software sectors. Chirag began his career as an investment banking Analyst at Goldman Sachs, where he focused on leveraged finance transactions for private equity and corporate clients.

Chirag serves on the board of Amplix and Zavation.

Chirag received a BA in International Relations, magna cum laude, from New York University.

John Ross

Principal

John Ross is a Principal at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, John was with Black Diamond Capital Management, a $9 billion alternative asset management firm, where he focused on the evaluation and execution of distressed private equity investments and was deeply involved in the turnaround of companies post-acquisition.

Prior to Black Diamond, John was an Associate at Irving Place Capital Management, a middle market private equity firm, where he was responsible for analyzing new investment opportunities, due diligence, and monitoring existing portfolio companies. John began his career as an investment banking Analyst at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, where he focused on the execution of M&A transactions across a broad range of industries and geographies.

John serves on the board of Cforia.

John received a BA in Economics and Government, cum laude, from Dartmouth College and an MBA from the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth, where he was an Edward Tuck Scholar.

Erich Sorger

Principal

Erich Sorger is a Principal at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Erich was a Principal and the second employee at Corbel Capital Partners, a $1 billion AUM firm focused on structured investments. In his eight years at Corbel, Erich led investments in performing and special situations across a diverse set of industries, including services, logistics, manufacturing, and consumer. He served on the boards of ARES Security Corp., Baker’s Computer Services, Brooklyn Brands, Cosmetic Design Group, LinkTrust, SpaceJet Media, and T3 Expo.

Prior to Corbel, Erich worked in the Private Equity group of Ares Management, a $300 billion alternative asset management firm, and completed the acquisitions of myTheresa.com and BlackBrush Oil & Gas. Prior to Ares, Erich worked in investment banking at Moelis & Company, and advised on over $12 billion in M&A. Erich began his career at Goldman Sachs within the Asset Management division. Erich also worked on monetary policy at the Bank of Israel, Israel’s central bank.

Erich received dual BS degrees in Economics and Engineering from the Wharton School and the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences at the University of Pennsylvania. He completed the Jerome Fisher Program in Management and Technology (M&T), as both a Joseph Wharton Scholar and Benjamin Franklin Scholar.

Kristin Brozyna

Director

Business Development

Kristin Brozyna is a Director of Business Development at Gemspring Capital. She is responsible for deal origination and driving the firm’s marketing and business development efforts.

Prior to Gemspring, Kristin spent nearly a decade as an investment banker, focused on advising financial and strategic clients across a variety of industries. Most recently, Kristin was a Vice President in the Advisory group at Evercore Partners. Prior to Evercore, she worked in the M&A group at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. She began her career at Harris Williams as an Associate.

Kristin received a BE in Civil Engineering from Vanderbilt University and an MBA from the University of Virginia.

Kathy Calio

Director

Operations

Kathy Calio is a Director of Operations at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Kathy was a Director in Central Management at Deutsche Bank in their Investment Banking division. She supported the Real Estate, Financial Sponsors, and Financial Institutions groups in the Americas as their COO and worked closely with senior management in the day-to-day operations of these businesses. Prior to joining Deutsche Bank, Kathy practiced corporate law at Davis Polk & Wardwell in New York, rotating through M&A and Capital Markets before specializing in Investment Management.

Kathy began her career as an investment banking Analyst at Morgan Stanley in the Real Estate, Gaming, Lodging, and Leisure group in New York and Milan.

Kathy received a BA in History, summa cum laude, from Princeton University and a JD from Columbia Law School where she was a Harlan Fiske Stone Scholar.

Kelsey Curtis

Director

Business Development

Kelsey (Lozier) Curtis is a Director of Business Development at Gemspring Capital. She is responsible for deal origination and driving the firm’s marketing and business development efforts.

Prior to Gemspring, Kelsey led business development and marketing efforts at Silver Oak Services Partners, a Chicago-based private equity firm focused on business, healthcare, and consumer services companies. Kelsey began her career on the investment team at Speyside Equity, a lower middle market private equity firm based in Detroit, where she focused on manufacturing and industrials.

Kelsey received a BA in Financial Management and Spanish from Hillsdale College.

Courtney Hamlin

Director

Investor Relations

Courtney Hamlin is a Director at Gemspring Capital focused on Investor Relations and ESG Initiatives.

Prior to Gemspring, Courtney was a member of the Investor Relations team at Corsair Capital, where she specialized in buyout and infrastructure strategies. Prior to Corsair, she was a Vice President at Acalyx Advisors, where she was involved in a number of fundraisings in the buyout, growth, and credit segments. Courtney began her career at GLG, where she supported general partners in their origination, diligence, and value-creation activities.

Courtney received a BA from the University of St Andrews.

Karl Rodger

Director

Business Development

Karl Rodger is a Director of Business Development at Gemspring Capital, where he plays an active role in sourcing transactions, executing new investments, and working alongside portfolio company management teams. Karl also leads the Capital Markets initiative at Gemspring and actively manages the firm’s relationships with a variety of lending partners. Throughout his career investing in the middle market, Karl has completed over 20 leveraged buyouts, corporate divestitures, founder recaps, and transformational add-on acquisitions, and has collaborated with management teams to develop and execute strategies that have driven growth in revenue and profitability.

Prior to Gemspring, Karl was a Vice President with Spire Capital Partners, an operationally oriented lower middle market private equity firm focused on technology, communications, media, and education services. Prior to Spire Capital, Karl worked for Dubin Clark & Company, a lower middle market private equity firm focused on investments in the business services, light manufacturing, and B2C rental industries. Earlier in his career, Karl spent time at The Riverside Company, where he helped invest out of the $1.2 billion North American fund. Karl began his career as an Analyst with Harris Williams, where he assisted in the execution of middle market M&A transactions.

Karl received a BA, magna cum laude, from Vanderbilt University and an MBA from the Fuqua School of Business at Duke University.

Matt Tharp

Director

Portfolio Operations

Matt Tharp is a Director of Portfolio Operations at Gemspring Capital. Matt has worked with over a dozen companies across a broad range of transformational initiatives including broad go-to-market strategies, sales effectiveness and enablement, holistic marketing transformation, operational excellence, organizational restructuring, merger management, product road mapping, and procurement/sourcing.

Prior to Gemspring, Matt was part of Vista Consulting Group, the operating arm of Vista Equity Partners. Matt served as a Value Creation Director at Vista, helping to design and implement the value creation agenda with a variety of Vista’s portfolio companies. Matt also served as an operating executive within Vista’s portfolio, most notably as a Vice President at Fusion Risk Management, a business continuity SaaS business.

Prior to Vista, Matt was a consultant at McKinsey & Company, where he led large-scale commercial transformations for McKinsey’s clients. Prior to McKinsey, Matt served in several direct sales roles, primarily in the medical device industry. Matt also served as a Captain in the United States Marine Corps. In the Marines, Matt served as an Amphibious Assault Officer, and led teams ranging from 40-200 Marines.

Matt serves on the boards of Cforia, Sigga, and OPEXUS.

Matt received a BA in Political Science and History from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and an MBA from the Kelley School of Business at Indiana University.

Jake Fenlon

Vice President

Jake Fenlon is a Vice President at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Jake was a Senior Associate at Providence Equity Partners, a private equity firm focused on growth-oriented investments. At Providence, Jake focused on the evaluation and execution of majority, minority, and strategic add-on investments across the media, communications, education, and technology industries. Jake started his career as an investment banking Analyst at Credit Suisse in the M&A group, where he focused on buy-side and sell-side advisory across a variety of sectors.

Jake received a BA in Economics from the University of Chicago, where he was also a Dougan Scholar at the Booth School of Business.

Thomas Henry

Vice President

Thomas Henry is a Vice President at Gemspring Capital. Prior to Gemspring, Thomas was an Associate at Palladin Consumer Retail Partners, a Boston-based private equity firm focused on control buyouts and growth investments in lower middle market consumer products and specialty retail businesses. While at Palladin, Thomas focused on evaluating and executing transactions and portfolio management initiatives at the fund level, and spent a year embedded full-time within KT Health, a Palladin portfolio company, to drive operational value creation. Thomas began his career as an investment banking Analyst with Wells Fargo Securities, where he executed M&A and leveraged finance transactions across a range of industries.

Thomas serves on the board of Amplix and Midland Industries.

Thomas received a BS in Business Administration from the University of Southern California’s Marshall School of Business and an MBA from Northwestern University’s Kellogg School of Management.

Reid Litowitz

Vice President

Reid Litowitz is a Vice President at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Reid was the Chief of Staff to the CEO of VelocityEHS, a Chicago-based software provider to the Environmental, Health & Safety market, before becoming Senior Director of Business Intelligence for the company. Prior to VelocityEHS, Reid was an Investment Executive at CVC Growth Partners, a New York-based growth equity firm investing in vertical software companies. Reid began his career as an investment banking Analyst with Harris Williams.

Reid received a BS in Finance from the University of Virginia.

Chris Lloyd

Vice President

Chris Lloyd is a Vice President at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Chris was a Senior Associate at American Securities, a New York-based private equity firm with more than $26 billion under management. At American Securities, Chris focused on the evaluation and execution of buyout and strategic add-on investments across multiple sectors including industrials, business services, and consumer.

Prior to American Securities, Chris was an investment banking Analyst in the M&A group at J.P. Morgan, where he focused on strategic and sponsor-related M&A across a variety of industries and geographies.

Chris serves on the boards of A10 Capital, Airswift, and Crafty Apes.

Chris received a BS in Accountancy from Brigham Young University.

Nathan Rakos

Vice President

Nathan Rakos is a Vice President at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Nathan was an Associate at Monomoy Capital Partners, a middle market private equity firm based in New York. At Monomoy, Nathan focused on the evaluation and execution of buyout and credit investments across the industrial and consumer markets. Prior to Monomoy, Nathan worked as an investment banking Analyst at Houlihan Lokey, where he focused on strategic and sponsor-related M&A within the business services sector.

Nathan received a BS in Computer Science and Finance from William & Mary.

Gardiner Schroeder

Vice President

Gardiner Schroeder is a Vice President at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Gardiner was an Associate at Re:Build Manufacturing, an investment holding company in Boston. At Re:Build, Gardiner focused on the evaluation and execution of investments across the aerospace & defense, industrial technology, and biotechnology sectors. Prior to joining Re:Build, Gardiner was an investment banking Analyst in the M&A group at Alantra where he focused on transaction advisory across a range of industrial verticals.

Gardiner received a BS in Finance, cum laude, from Bentley University.

James Simpson

Vice President

James Simpson is a Vice President at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, James worked at Gallant Capital, a Los Angeles-based private equity firm. At Gallant, James focused on the evaluation and execution of control and non-control investments across a range of industries, with a focus on the aerospace & defense and business services sectors. Prior to joining Gallant, James worked as an investment banking Analyst at Centerview Partners, where he focused on M&A, restructuring, and activist defense mandates across a range of industries, and as a paralegal at Latham & Watkins.

James received an MA from the University of Cambridge.

Tyler Feldman

Senior Associate

Tyler Feldman is a Senior Associate at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Tyler was an Associate at AQR Capital Management, a hedge fund based in Greenwich, Connecticut. At AQR, Tyler focused on the execution of long-term strategic projects for clients relating to multi-asset portfolio construction. Prior to AQR, Tyler worked as an investment banking Associate at Canaccord Genuity / Petsky Prunier, where he focused on sell-side M&A in the middle market.

Tyler received a BA in Economics from Brown University and an MBA from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

Nick Miller

Senior Associate

Nick Miller is a Senior Associate at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Nick was an Associate at Stella Point Capital, a middle market private equity firm based in New York. At Stella Point, Nick evaluated and executed buyout and strategic add-on acquisitions across a variety of industries. Prior to Stella Point, Nick worked as an investment banking Analyst at Citigroup, executing M&A and capital markets transactions for a variety of firms within the consumer & retail industries.

Nick received a BS in Finance and Economics from the University of Oregon.

Kelley Weibezahl

Senior Associate

Kelley Weibezahl is a Senior Associate at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Kelley was an Associate at Cortec Group, a middle market private equity firm based in New York. At Cortec, Kelley focused on the evaluation and execution of buyout and strategic add-on investments across a range of industries. Prior to Cortec, Kelley worked as an investment banking Analyst at Piper Sandler, where she focused on strategic and sponsor-related M&A within the healthcare services sector. Kelley began her career in PricewaterhouseCoopers’ Deal Advisory practice.

Kelley received a BS in Accounting and Finance from Lehigh University.

Raymond Zhao

Senior Associate

Raymond Zhao is a Senior Associate at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Ray was a Senior Associate at D Cubed Group, a middle market private equity firm based in New York. While at D Cubed, Ray evaluated and executed a number of platform investments and strategic add-ons, primarily within the consumer and business services sectors. Prior to D Cubed, Ray worked as an investment banking Analyst at Jefferies, where he focused on M&A, leveraged buyouts, and capital raises within the healthcare sector.

Ray received a BBA with high distinction in Finance and Accounting from the University of Michigan.

Yanna Hebel

Assistant Controller

Yanna Hebel is an Assistant Controller at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Yanna was Head of Vendor Accounting Operations at Point72 leading month end close, accounts payable, T&E, and business tax functions for management companies and investment ventures globally and domestically. Prior to Point72, Yanna held accounting leadership roles at Crius Energy and Early Advantage.

Yanna received a BS in International Business and Accounting, summa cum laude, from the University of Bridgeport and an MBA from Fairfield University.

Brian Kantor

Assistant Controller

Brian Kantor is an Assistant Controller at Gemspring Capital.

Prior to Gemspring, Brian was the Assistant Controller at First Eagle Investments, a private equity firm specializing in direct lending, distressed credit, and tradeable credit strategies. While at First Eagle, Brian handled fund accounting and financial reporting for public entities and private partnerships. Prior to First Eagle, Brian was a Senior Manager at PricewaterhouseCoopers, where he served a variety of clients primarily focused on private equity, private debt, and other alternative investment strategies. Brian began his career at Rothstein Kass & Co as an auditor serving financial services companies.

Brian received a BBA in Accounting from the University of Notre Dame. He is a Certified Public Accountant registered in New Jersey and New York.

Cforia

Status: Realized. Acquired by HighRadius Corporation.

Sector: Software

Investment Date: July 2020

HQ: Westlake Village, CA

www.cforia.com

Cforia is a leading provider of order-to-cash automation software focused on improving collections and cash management for B2B customers globally. The Cforia platform was designed to help companies accelerate the conversion of accounts receivable to cash in order to better manage credit exposure and reduce cost of capital and expense. Cforia’s success has been driven by superior technology that leverages proprietary, real-time data integration tools that work across complex and disparate ERP systems.

GoldenSource

Status: Active

Sector: Software

Investment Date: May 2022

HQ: New York, NY

www.thegoldensource.com

GoldenSource is a provider of Enterprise Data Management (EDM) and Master Data Management (MDM) solutions for financial services customers. GoldenSource’s offerings help some of the world’s largest and most prominent investments banks, asset managers, and capital markets services firms manage and derive insights from their data, including equity and debt securities, customers, entities, and other data types.

Please contact Reid Litowitz for add-on acquisition opportunities.

OPEXUS

Status: Active

Sector: Software

Investment Date: November 2021

HQ: Washington, D.C.

www.opexustech.com

OPEXUS (f/k/a AINS) is a leading provider of case management software solutions and IT services for government agencies and other public sector organizations. The OPEXUS software enables organizations to streamline and automate workflows across a wide variety of use cases, spanning FOIA (Freedom of Information Act), audits, investigations, human resources, and contract management.

Please contact Michael Fan for add-on acquisition opportunities.

Radancy

Status: Acquired by an affiliate of New Mountain Capital. Gemspring maintains a minority investment in the business.

Sector: Software and Tech Enabled Services

Investment Date: April 2018

HQ: New York, NY

www.radancy.com

Radancy (f/k/a TMP Worldwide) is a global talent technology leader focused on intelligently solving the most critical challenges for employers and delivering results that strengthen their organizations. Through its unified Platform, augmented by rich data and deep industry expertise, Radancy is revolutionizing how employers attract and hire the talent they need.

Please contact Chirag Hirawat for add-on acquisition opportunities.

Shrieve Chemical Company

Status: Active

Sector: Industrial Services

Investment Date: December 2019

HQ: The Woodlands, TX

www.shrieve.com

Shrieve is a value-added marketer of industrial chemicals, performance fluids and specialty lubricants. The company markets and sells over 700 products into more than 40 countries with support from manufacturing and research and development facilities in North America and Asia. Since its founding in 1978, Shrieve has been known for its market knowledge, consistency of supply, exceptional customer support and service, broad product slate and logistics capabilities.

Please contact Geoff Broglio for add-on acquisition opportunities.

Sigga Technologies

Status: Active

Sector: Software

Investment Date: December 2020

HQ: Sugar Land, TX

www.sigga.com

Sigga is a leading provider of Enterprise Asset Management (“EAM”) software, offering a comprehensive suite of solutions that fully integrate with SAP and enable asset-intensive businesses to more efficiently manage their maintenance and repair operations. Sigga’s success has been driven by its superior, purpose-built technology that is designed to directly address the needs of maintenance personnel and has been refined through Sigga’s two decades of experience in the EAM space.

Please contact Stephen Reynolds for add-on acquisition opportunities.

Skyline Displays

Status: Active

Sector: Business Services

Investment Date: January 2020

HQ: Eagan, MN

www.skyline.com

Skyline Displays is a leading provider of displays, exhibits and services for trade shows and large corporate events. It is a vertically integrated business with exhibit and display design and manufacturing capabilities as well as asset management, installation and dismantling, and equipment rental services. Skyline’s customers are seamlessly served across the United States and internationally through its network of more than 75 locations, including 27 Skyline-owned retail centers, four regional service centers, and 45 independent dealers.

Please contact Kristin Steen for add-on acquisition opportunities.

Therma Holdings

Status: Realized. Acquired by an affiliate of The Blackstone Group.

Sector: Facility Services

Investment Date: June 2017

HQ: San Jose, CA

www.therma.com

Therma Holdings is a full-service, design-build mechanical and electrical solutions provider that focuses on complex HVAC systems, high purity process piping and process controls. Primary customers are in the bio-pharmaceutical, semiconductor, data center, electronics, education and internet/software industries. Services include design, installation and maintenance of HVAC and energy efficiency systems, piping for water, gas, lab waste, compressed air and other processes, air balancing, modular skids, building information modeling and custom fabrication.

Valant Medical Solutions

Status: Realized. Acquired by an affiliate of Resurgens Technology Partners.

Sector: Software

Investment Date: April 2019

HQ: Seattle, WA

www.valant.com

Valant is a leading provider of electronic health record and practice management software for the behavioral health market. Built with the specific needs of mental health professionals in mind, the company’s cloud-based software enables practitioners to efficiently schedule, document, and bill patients from a single, seamlessly integrated offering. Valant serves over 2,000 private practices and 12,000 behavioral health professionals across the United States.
